intro: Ageratina viburnoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Ageratina viburnoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
